content.description: Follow the slightly left-trending crack system, which starts as hands and then becomes layback fingers. Right below the lip at some jugs, traverse right 10 feet, and follow the seam/crack over the bulge. There are no anchors, but a top rope can easily be set up on gear.
content.protection: Bring a full set of stoppers, singles of Camalots #0.5-2, and slings for the traverse.
content.location: Standing at the base of the main buttress under the large roofs, walk climber''s left around the main arete. Look up at the slightly left-trending crack system.

content.description: Begin in the low angle notch below the massive roof, and scramble up to the ledge. Follow the cracks up past a large horn to the base of the roof and chimney. Get the #2 and #3 ready, reach up high into the crack, pull up into the chimney, and begin stemming and jamming to the lip.
content.protection: Singles of Camalots from #0.5-3. Doubles in #2 and #3 may be useful.
content.location: This is in the center of the main face, going up the overhanging crack and chimney feature.
